meanings.definition: A sudden fear or distressing suspense caused by an awareness of danger.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise of the alarms startled everyone in the building.
meanings.sent2: The alarms in the house went off when smoke was detected in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The little boy's fear of monsters under the bed set off imaginary alarms in his head.
meanings.sent4: The alarms in her mind blared loudly as she walked through the dark alley.
meanings.sent5: The alarms of danger rang in her ears, making her heart race with fear.

meanings.definition: A device that gives a loud warning signal in response to a danger or emergency.
meanings.sent1: The alarms on the cars helped prevent theft in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to test the alarms in the building regularly to ensure they work properly.
meanings.sent3: The cat's collar had a tiny bell that acted as an adorable alarm when it moved.
meanings.sent4: The alarms on the ships guided them safely through the foggy waters.
meanings.sent5: The alarms on the doors alerted the security guard of any unauthorized entry.

meanings.definition: To fill with apprehension, anxiety, or fear.
meanings.sent1: The thought of failing the test alarms him greatly.
meanings.sent2: She alarms easily at the sound of thunder during a storm.
meanings.sent3: His exaggerated reaction to the spider on the wall alarms his friends.
meanings.sent4: The news of the approaching storm alarms the residents of the coastal town.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in his behavior alarms his family members.
